alert.note: Alert for Kemper; Neshoba (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 24 at 8:11PM CDT until March 24 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR WESTERN KEMPER AND SOUTHEASTERN NESHOBA COUNTIES... At 810 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Herbert Springs, or 13 miles southeast of Philadelphia, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Damascus and Forestdale around 815 PM CDT. Liberty around 820 PM CDT. Bluff Springs around 825 PM CDT. De Kalb around 830 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Tucker. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for east central Mississippi. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
